chunks.summary: The SDN (Software-Defined Networking) architecture comprises three layers: the application layer, control layer, and physical layer. The control layer houses the controller, which acts as the network's operating system, facilitating communication between applications in the application layer and physical or virtual networking devices in the physical layer through northbound and southbound interfaces, respectively. This separation of the control plane from individual devices enhances network management and flexibility compared to traditional networking models.
